body_html:
Using dot - graphviz version 2.40.1 (20161225.0304), I get a more precise confirmation from graphviz about the problem:

 Error: hlo_graph_47.mcrbox-6dffc700-28862-565e07de51010.dot: syntax error in line 10 scanning a quoted string (missing endquote? longer than 16384?)
String starting:"
  data:text/css,
  @import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:4

In graphviz, the buffer size is defined as 2^14:

#define YY_BUF_SIZE 16384

I put it up to 2^20 and built graphviz from source, and I can now render the HLO as SVG.

Internally we have an interactive tool which can render subsets of the graph.

This sounds good and indeed necessary for ever-larger graphs, let us know if/when there is movement on releasing it.

body:
Using `dot - graphviz version 2.40.1 (20161225.0304)`, I get a more precise confirmation from graphviz about the problem:

     Error: hlo_graph_47.mcrbox-6dffc700-28862-565e07de51010.dot: syntax error in line 10 scanning a quoted string (missing endquote? longer than 16384?)
    String starting:"
      data:text/css,
      @import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:4

In graphviz, the buffer size is defined as 2^14:

    #define YY_BUF_SIZE 16384

I put it up to 2^20 and built graphviz from source, and I can now render the HLO as SVG. 

> Internally we have an interactive tool which can render subsets of the graph.

This sounds good and indeed necessary for ever-larger graphs, let us know if/when there is movement on releasing it.
